Reason: The configuration 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' is considered performance-sensitive. This is because setting the threshold for garbage collection pauses directly impacts the system's performance and responsiveness. The configuration involves performance-related operations that can significantly affect the execution time and memory consumption at the system level. By adjusting this threshold, developers can influence the frequency and duration of garbage collection pauses, which in turn can have notable performance variations on the overall system performance. Therefore, the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration is classified as performance-sensitive.
